attributes.action: Railways to be renationalised, end UK having the highest rail prices in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
Action for Rail -  Transport for Quality of Life report.
TUC study into inflation and rail fares.
TUC report on public ownership https://www.tuc.org.uk/sites/default/files/TUC%20summary%20TfQL%20analysis%20March%202015_0.pdf
attributes.background:
The UK pays the most expensive rail fares in Europe. Season tickets and other regulated fares have steamed ahead by 25% since 2010, while average pay has only gone up by 9%. 
If railways were renationalised season tickets would be 10% cheaper by 2017 and save 1.5 billion within 5 years.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:  

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104644

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
